user_review: The smoked meat was phenomenal, the onion soup delicious, the beer crisp, and the service very friendly. The smoked meat sandwich was delicious. The smoked meat was so flavourful, juicy, and melt-in-your-mouth tender. We were not hungry when we got in there, but we ended up ordering another sandwich after finishing the first. So good.No line and you get to sit down. Highly recommend!

The lineup might be across the street but I'll say it. I'm putting my foot down! THIS IS THE BEST SMOKED MEAT. This place feels like a time warp when you walk in. It is exactly how I remember it always was. We would stop in at the Main for smoked meat and pickles after a night out. I've been wasting my time going to other smoked meat places trying to satisfy the craving because I hate having to find parking on st Laurent. This is well worth the trip and I will be back again because now this is all I want to eat forever.  I always get the medium fat, my husband gets the fatty and he loves it! Even the coleslaw tasted better than other places... I can't put my finger on what is different but it made me so happy!They've got steaks, salads and take orders to go. Apparently they cook on charcoal so ordering a grilled fish or meat would be really good and I'll definitely be back to try a steak! I'm so mad at myself for not going back sooner. I forgot how amazing this place is and it should be on everyone's list.

Hands down the best smoked meat sandwich I've ever had. It was also less crowded here, not loud and the service was excellent. Wish I could get this all the time! It was very hearty. Not dry at all. The bread was soft and a great addition.

If the line is too long at Schwartz, you need a beer with your drink or you have people in your party who want something other than smoked meat then go across the street to Main Deli for an equally delicious meal. In my opinion the smoked meat is almost just as good, but their menu is so much more expansive and they serve alcohol. In addition to the meat I love the potato pancakes which are pretty large and can come with sour cream or apple sauce. The liver appetizer is good and comes with a huge portion. Two people I went with last time got the turkey club sandwich and loved it. I've only ever been here kind of late but it's never been too busy and the service is friendly. If I lived closer I would probably come here more often. It's a great deli experience !

Gimme 'dat smoked meat!It was around 9pm and we just got off a flight and needed sustenance and this spot is open to the wee hours of the morning. I walked from our air bnb and made conversation with the guy at the counter. He suggested if wanted something not too heavy, go with the combo, and that is what we did. A smoked meat sandwich and a small order of poutine. 'Twas perfect for two not looking for a full, heavy meal at 10pm. The meat was so juicy and succulent on fresh rye bread, and the small poutine was perfection. And this was take out mind you and ready in 5 minutes! Not the cheapest meal; all in, with 2 Quebecois cherry cokes about $25, but we were full and so satisfied. Overall, they say Schwartz's is king, but they say there always a line and it's pricey. I gotta say this was A+ in my books, no line, opened late, and great service!

The line was way too long at Schwartz's, and we didn't want to wait. We ordered smoked meat sandwiches, cole slaw, and pickles. Everything was delicious! The smoked meat was so tender, flavorful, and juicy.The food itself was definitely worth five stars, but the customer service was really lacking.Honestly, even if Schwartz's is better, I would pick not having to wait for the same meal I can get across the street any day.

I'm a tourist, so I don't have any room to comment on "best smoked meat in Montreal." But as a meat enthusiast, Main Deli was absolutely incredible. My friends and I showed up to Schwartz's on a hot summer's day only to find a line down the block. I found Main Deli on a local blog ranking smoked meat, and since it was right across the street, we bailed from the line and headed over. We made the right choice. The atmosphere was awesome, clearly a hole-in-the wall spot that caters mostly to locals but is also happy to have tourists join them. The waitstaff was patient while we all assembled ourselves and settled in, and then explained the menu and all of the "upgrade" options for sides. We all got Ruben platters, and then upgraded some of our sides to poutine and onion rings. Let's start with the meat. Oh, the meat. It's tender and juicy without being greasy or fatty, and literally melts in your mouth as you bite into it. Of course the portions are huge, but you won't want to stop eating it. I'm glad I got a Ruben because there was just enough cheese and sauerkraut to balance out the bread and meat. The sides were all great. The poutine had a well-flavored pizza coating every single fry, and plenty of curds to munch on. The onion rings were a surprising stand-out -- if you don't want to go all the way with poutine but still want to mix it up, you can't go better then these. And the coleslaw was a sleeper hit! It was more like a yummy cabbage salad with lots of vinegar, and was a welcome bite of freshness to break up the meat. All in, I paid $33 CAD for more delicious food than anyone could eat in a day and a Diet Coke, and enjoyed every bite that I could get in. I have no idea what Schwartz's is really like, but the food and vibe here seem a lot better than standing in line.

Best grilled liver ever! Great portions with a fraction of the wait from their neighbor across the street. My local mural tour guide recommended this as one of his favorites as a native of Montréal.I had a combo veal and smoked meat sandwich, heavenly. Tender, flavorful, and plentiful. I put it in the same realm as Katz's and Manny's of the world.Everything also comes with fries! We had so much food!

The Main makes a solid smoked meat sandwich which is a good alternative to Schwartz's when the line there is long. They also have a much more extensive menu than Schwartz's with a variety of steaks, sandwiches, soups and poutines. I particularly enjoyed the matzoh ball soup. One star deducted because on our second visit, we arrived right at opening and they were not yet prepared To serve smoked meat because it was cold. Otherwise we had a very good lunch there.
I got main burger and the meat  was like hockey puck. I don't recommend anyone to try it.

I like them better than Schwartz.  Main Deli Steak House does not get the recognition and hype of the competition across the street.  Do not let that stop you from dining here.  In my opinion,  the Smoked Meat is more delicious here.Admittedly, they were my backup choice.  Since it was my parents and my sister and her family's first time trying Montreal's Smoked Meat, I wanted them to try the world famous Schwartz's Deli.  Fortunately, their line was so long, and we did not have an extra hour to wait.  So, I brought them to Main Deli Steak House across the street.  There was no wait and plenty of available seating.Service was attentive without being intrusive.  Ambiance was comfortable.  Our order came out in good time.  All the food we tried was scrumptious.  My favorites were the Smoked Meat Poutine and the Smoked Meat sandwich.  Their smoked meat is very flavorful.  Makes everything taste better.Maybe one day, I will take them back to Schwartz's just so they can say they've tried it.  In my opinion, though, Main Deli Steak House is the superior choice in beautiful Montreal!!!!  Don't take my word....check them out yourself.

This place was recommended to us by David, our Uber driver yesterday, and it didn't disappoint. Quiet, deli-style sandwiches among other delicious-looking dishes. The smoked meat sandwich was huge and piled high with smoked meat and a swipe of mustard (the pics are of the 'regular' size...would be shocked to see the 'jumbo' they also offer). The flavor was perfect! The sandwich itself was an entire meal (only thing missing was a pickle spear). Definitely delish and would come again if we were staying in town longer

While the line of people stretches on a Schwartz's Deli just across the street, you can get a very good smoked meat sandwich at Main Deli.  The sandwich was packed with moist, tender, flavorful meat.  We stopped in, without a wait, and enjoyed our lunch.

It is my first time to try Montreal smoked meat sandwich and both me and my friend knew we chose the right place. This place was recommended by my local friends over Schwartz.They did not skimp on the meat. The meat itself was tender and taste really smokey. They have a choice of medium fat which is more meatier than fat but still very good (I just prefer more fats but its just me). The coleslaw is perfect: not too sour and very far from what you get on KFC (in a good way); its the perfect compliment for the sometimes overpowering smoke flavour.  The fries with gravy is like poutine minus the cheese curds.Overall this shop sets a very high bar for all the other shops I would like to try. Good value for money too. It will be interesting to see if Schwartz is all worth the hype.
Best hot dog I've had. Great Jewish deli. Got a pastrami sandwich and a jumbo hot dog for a side. Toasted sesame bun and the quality of meat was just tremendous.

I honestly think this place is better than Schwartz's and Lester's. You avoid all the lines for better smoked meat sandwiches and delicious poutine! It's funny to see people getting off the bus, running over to Schwartz's to lineup as we casually walk across the street to Main Deli.Its a small place but has lots of seating. The restaurant seems a little dated but I think that's what they're going for. You can order take-out for this place too!We got the regular Smoked Meat Sandwich and a Classic Poutine. The sandwich was perfect, everything like I remembered and better than when I had it 2 years ago. It was cooked perfectly with the right amount of flavour and softness. The poutine was also yummy with freshly made crispy fries, cheese curds, and a tasty light/less salty gravy. I absolutely loved this place and I would recommend this over any other smoked meat places in Mtl!
Main is great - they're open super late, and the line is about 100x less annoying than some nearby establishments. Highly recommend!

A LOCAL's FAVORITE! It is in plain sight right in front of Schwartz's, which I gave a few tries but never seemed to grasp why it became so popular, but doesn't receive enough attention it deserves.The meat is just so moist AND flavourful and the chopped liver is to die for, although their lunch special deal is not as good as it used to be.Of course, don't forget to order a Black cherry coke and put a lot of mustard with your smoked meat. Simply heaven!

+.5 for serviceYeah I've done the whole Schwartz's thing and do believe their smoked meat is good. Therefore why better than to try out Schwartz's arch rival across the street, Main Deli?Main Deli IMO has a more diverse menu, focusing on more than just smoked meat. I personally like it that way, though I can understand others who think it lacks having true specialties. While I definitely had their smoked meat sandwich, I also tried other items such as their french onion soup and hot dog.Their smoked meat sandwich was certainly very good, pretty much the same level as Schwartz's and Smoke Meat Pete. However, I actually thought their highlight was the french onion soup. It is the most delicious french onion soup I've ever had, and I've had a lot in my life. The cheese is very thick and flavourful, and the soup itself is delicious in itself. Good amount of croutons inside as well.Service is very good, and the environment is definitely more laid back compared to the rushed service you get at Schwartz's. Honestly I would recommend everyone to visit Schwartz's just once, but you get an equally good deal here without the wait in line.

Totally stumbled upon this place when we parked out front next to the darling deck with red umbrellas and outdoor seating when hubs was stopping across the way (at the competiton). I happen to glance at the menu in the window and noticed a vegetable poutine! It was early morning and definitely not the right time be eating such a thing, but I just HAD to try it! It was the only vegetarian poutine I had seen in all of Montreal! I thought this was too good to be true...I entered the retro looking diner-esque place and asked the hostess if the gravy was vegetarian. It indeed was. I was sold....About $12 Canadian later and the huge portion of deliciousness was in my hands. Peppers, onions and mushrooms with very tasty gravy and cheese. I totally forgot to say no to that. I actually completely missed it in the listed ingredients as I was just too excited to try poutine! Vegans, it's totally avoidable as it's larger chunks which can just be taken off, but just ask for it without. I was thrilled with this very hearty, flavorful comfort food treat! Highly recommend for any fellow veg head out there! It was absolutely delicious!! They are really known for the corned beef sammys, smoked meats of all kinds and other classic Jewish delicatessen foods such and matzah ball soup, latkes etc. I hear it's actually a great, less crowded alternative to the hotspot across the way. Perhaps hubs will this place a try next time instead!! I know I'll be back! The newspaper articles and decor shows that they are very well established in the business. Give it a go if you haven't already!The outdoor seats were so perfect on a beautiful autumn morn!

3.5 stars Went to Main Deli Steak House with the expectation that it would be better than Schwartz - all the reviewers say so. Delicious smoked meat without an hour of standing in the frigid street and maybe our own table seems like a dream.  Started with the Matzo ball soup which was lightly seasoned, rich in flavour and just the thing for a cold winter evening. The sandwiches were good - stacked symmetrically with a generous amount of smoked meat. However, it lacked the balance between lean and fatty, so the sandwich turned out to be slightly dry and salty. Still, it was yummy.Overall, great service, old-timey atmosphere and none of that hour long wait nonsense. But, I would look elsewhere for the perfect smoked meat sandwich.

I'll be honest. We waited in line for Schwartz's first.Felt obliged. The longer we waited in, the more we realized that we should just try the smoked meat and then head over to the Main across the street for a bigger meal. So glad we did. Not to knock Schartz's. But I think in the mass quantities they must deliver, their quality suffers.As for Main? Wow. Amazing meal!Started with the borscht, which was delicious. Then had their Reuben with fries, slaw and pickle.Hands down, one of the BEST, JUICIEST reubens I have EVER had. Seriously. Mazal tov, Main! I LOVE your food!Update: On second thought, Main's Reuben is the BEST Reuben sandwich I've ever had!

Montreal smoked meat without have to wait an hour to eat! We started with the matzo ball soup! It was delicious and warmed us up! The smoked meat sandwich here is huge and super juicy, peppery, and awesome. Grab a cherry cola and it's pretty comparable any Schwartzs experience. Except you get to eat in comfort! :)

Came here since Schwartz was too packed and didnt regret it. The smoked meat sandwich was amazing. Meat was very tender and juicy and had lots of flavour. The fries were also great, and tasted very fresh; they would be perfect if I made it a poutine. The portions are very generous when you order it as a combo.A lot of people say the place is dirty but it didnt seem so, just came off to me as a typical diner restaurant and still cleaner than other fast food style diners in the area.

Sebastian, our guide from a fabulous food tour told about Main across the street from Schwartz's which is as good without the way. Schwartz's wait was over 30 minutes or longer.Main is the nickname for St Laurent Blvd.The smoked beef is definitely different and worth trying.

I'm going to counter this one star review with the fact that we came here twice in 2017 and had a good experience, the fact that this is still one star should give you a decent indication of just how bad this experience was, however if you're interested in the details, please read on...To start with we were met with indifference, it wasn't particularly late, and it's Montreals busiest weekend of the year, so every business is embracing that, apart from this place.We were giving about a minute between having menus thrown at us and being asked 'yes?' Which we assumed by the look and tone of the 'waitress' was her way of asking us what we would like. We ordered some latka to start, more as attempt to give us time to actually read the menu more than anything else.The 'latka' arrived, way too quickly, clearly reconstituted from the day, imagine a hockey puck thrice fried in old margarine, then deep fry it in week old oil and you'd be about there.For our main course we ordered the poutine with ground beef, and the 'q' burger.The 'poutine' was some sad old fries that clearly couldn't wait to die, covered in a brown runny liquid that nobody in their right minds would ever call gravy, ever. It was topped off with 'ground beef', which was clearly an old chopped up burger which had a suspiciously similar texture and taste to the hockey puck latka.And then come the 'q' burger. This burger was the equivalent of your tinder date date sending you pictures of Marylyn Monroe and turning out to be Marylyn Manson, which would be awesome if that was what you were expecting, but not when you're preference leans towards the Monroe end of the Marylyn spectrum. It was totally devoid of any of their 'famous' bbq sauce, it was drier than the Sahara during a drought, and the 'bun' on which it was served had the consistency of bread that has been at sea for a week and washed up on a beach.As if the 'cuisine' wasn't bad enough, the 'waitress' decided to call my wife all kinds of names in French assuming that we wouldn't understand, and describe anyone going to, or coming from a formula 1 race as morons. We are not fluent, but we know enough.Just to add insult to injury, rather then removing the burger that was nothing like the thing they advertised from the bill, she added herself a tip without asking.So in summary, if you like really shit food, dreadful service served up by someone who should have been put out to pasture a decade ago, and enjoy being insulted behind your back too. Then you've found your spot.Make the most of soon though, this establishment has no place in what is a vibrant and wonderful city, and I for one will be happy to see it go.

Not my favourite place for a Montreal Smoked Meat Sandwich. I've tried now 3 different places for the Montreal Smoked Meat Sandwiches. I went with my family who was in Montreal one person who lives here raved and suggested we try it. Even though I am a fan fave of Rueben's. We were seated in the diner which wasn't the greatest for me. As well there is a $3 min for each person to eat. Even if you wanted to share a monster of a sandwich. We decided to eat out since the day was nice. Our sandwiches sat at the service window for 10 minutes. I also tried to go at 4 am and get a sandwich but they were closed when they were supposed to be open until 5 am. Overall I was not impressed with the texture of the Smoked Meat. Save your money and go to Rueben's. It's much cleaner and friendlier then this place.

You guys must be going to a Main Deli in parallel universe, coz in my universe here, this place's service deserve zero star, the one star was for the food since I had no prior experience of what smoke meats were, would be fair to at least give them one star.This venue was recommended by our uber driver on our way to Schwartz, and of coz Schwartz has a long line as always and we were not in the mood of standing in line so went across the street to this place. It was actually almost packed but they only had 2-3 waiting staff and boy they couldn't be ruder.  First of all, no one told you or seat you since all of them were so busy servicing folks already there.  We helped ourselves to an empty table (with dirty dishes on of coz）and our waitress complained at us for not being patient.  But judging from their speed, we could've stood there until dinner time.  Took the lady 10 mins to get the menu, then another 10-15 to get tap water, and then another 20mins to get our food while missing quite a few components of some of our combo meals.   By the end, I wasn't even willing to stay there for any longer even to get my missing food.  During the time there, we witnessed a few confrontations between local/QC customers and the waiting staff, the waiting staff and dude (chef with bare hands touching the smoke meats!!) behind the counter.  Had it not been so bad in service, could've been a nice spot to watch street drama.  DO NOT go to this place if you were just dodging the line at Schwartz.  For the time we spent to finish our meal at the this place, we should've been able to line up at Schwartz and got the hyped up food.  Instead, stupid us will now leave Montreal with an unanswered question: how good the Schwartz smoke meats are...

Great restaurant that calls themselves the locals favourite for smoked meat (as opposed to Schwartz being the tourist favourite). Food was good, the smoked meat poutine was really good! The server was rude though, telling my fiancé to order something else because the hot chicken will take a while to make (it didn't). Also didn't seem to want to let my friend order a coffee. Otherwise good local experience.

We walked over to Schwartz's, saw the line, and came here instead.  DELICIOUS.  The smoked meat sandwich is delicious, salty, and satisfying.  Plus you can eat outside!  So walk over to Schwartz's, see the line, and then go here instead.  Apparently this is where the locals go.

I might rate 5 stars, except this place is pretty dirty. But, hey, the smoked meat is really good. Usually juicier than more tender than Schwartz's across the street. You can choose lean/medium/fatty cuts. I always opt for medium or fatty. I've tried the pickled ox tongue sandwich as well, which is not bad, but i think smoked meat is the way to go. Super casual place and the waitresses are always friendly. There hasn't been a line up the many times I've been.

I only did take out so I can't comment on dine-in service. It was a late Friday night and the restaurant was not that busy. My sandwich was literally ready to go in like 2 minutes, so I am very happy with the fast service. The server who took my order was very nice. My sandwich was "medium". Although the size is a bit questionable in a general sense, the meat was stacked enough. Since my experience with Schwartz was so disappointing, I have no reference point. One bite into this sandwich, you will feel that this is VERY peppery. The presence of peppercorns in the sandwich is so strong that all you can taste is peppercorns. I usually like black pepper as a condiment but this was almost too much. The meat was soft and moist enough. By its texture, it looked like brisket. I don't know if smoked meat sandwiches in Montreal get any better than this, but I am ok a journey to find a better one.
There's a reason Schwartz (right across the street) has long lines, and Main Deli does not. The dishes are pricier at Main and also much less tasty as well. Service is also non-existent.

Originally went to Schwartz but there was a long lineup so decided to try this place out, it was just across the street. They have nice outside sitting area, the food was great and served verfy quick. The staff were super nice and the price was worth it. The cook their rib steak sandwich on charcoal.
When Swartz is lined up for hours, walk across the street and give Main a try. Day in day out consistent and great. Well done.

We ducked-into Main Deli the first time a few years ago when we spotted the ridiculous line-up at Schwartz's across the street. On this trip to Montreal we again visited Main Deli because my partner was craving Montreal smoked meat. We each ordered the special and my partner also ordered a beer. The smoked meat on rye (side of slaw, fries and a pickle) was delicious. The waitress was pleasant and helpful and the place is decorated with humorous caricatures. That said, it was also pricey, the lunch costing us $50 with tax and tip.

I was contemplating giving this place a 4 star out of 5, then my friend explained to me why they have the restaurant planned out the way they do.I was going to give 4 stars because the poutine I ordered was AMAAZZZINNNG...however wayyy too much, and after having 2 beers to help me wash it all down...the washroom was located a bit of a walk away...down the hall...up very large flight of stairs...around the corner...then finally you see the washroom.  The walk was much needed to help digestion, and the digestion was much needed because after the first bite(even tho it was a bit salty - guess that's why the beer's cheap), you just can't stop, even when your stomach is screaming surrender and throwing up the white flag, you just keep shoveling it into your mouth, 1 forkfull at a time.I highly recommend trying this place out, you won't regret it!Also recommend getting an airbnb around the area...that way you can try out Schwartz's smoked meat sandwiches during another meal!

This place is the BOMB!!! The food was unbelievably delicious and the service we received from Angelo was fantastic. Taking some meat home to Victoria in a vacuum-sealed pack for my hubby. Better, in my opinion, than across the street and no queues. You won't be disappointed. We will be back!
Food was excellent; 1st time eating Montreal smoked meat in Montreal and it was delicious ! Service was good and quick.  Smoked meat poutine was killer.  Definitely would go back

8/10 Like all tourists, we had planned on eating at Schwartz. Like most bachelor parties, we were too hung over to get it together (and wait in line) so we ended up with an impromptu meal at Main Deli. It was a stroke of good fortune!I had the burger with smoked deli meat which was juicy and intense with flavor. It was a great burger on its own and was amazing with the extra meat. I asked for the fries as poutine (love me some poutine) and they brought me a side of gravy. They would get 5 stars if they had the cheese... (my heart would give out if I lived in Montreal)We ate outside which is very pleasant when the weather is good. It's a busy street and a great spot to people watch. I'd definitely stop by if in the area and looking for lunch.

If you like red meat, this is the place for you. They have sandwiches, burgers, poutines, bbq ribs. It's better than Schwartz and It has no huge wait lines. The waitress was friendly and we had good service.I had the Main Burger (has smoked meat and 1 burger patty), and my friend had the Main Q burger (1 burger patty, bacon and a fried ...something), very very good!
delicious motza ball soup - perfect for this freezing cold weather! the latkes were absolutely wonderful! perfectly crispy and tasty! great music selection with that diner feel in the restaurant!

Honestly I don't see what the big fuss is with smoked meat.  I came here on a hot and humid evening because the line at Schwartz was way too long and we were starving. Anyways, I have the say that I did enjoy the cherry cola and the portions were huge, but the service wasn't too great.  Perhaps it's just that I'm not a huge fan of smoked meat but I found that this place wasn't as cramped as Schwartz (I went the week after) and there was no long wait.Also, it was really nice that we weren't jammed packed into a small table unlike at Schwartz. (The 7 of us were packed into a table meant for 4 there!)  I liked the coleslaw and the gravy but I found the fries almost too crispy.

In short, I like it.  Tried Dunn's and Schartwz.  This is the mid of the pack.  Scharwtz came just a bit on top because they allow you to choose the cut off the meat.The streetside patio is more interesting then Dunn's just because it is along st Laurent. The surprising jewel is their coleslaw!Worth a try, especially when scharwtz doesn't have room.  It is more family friendly.

This is why you come here. Though I think their rib steak is great too. Perfect smoked meat sandwich, fries, stash of cherry Cott's, sour pickle, good coleslaw (a bit sweet for me but just a touch). They decor is old school and a bit diner/dive. I don't care. You come for the food and it's legit. Maybe it's a memory, or you're having a new experience, but you picked the right place. Old-school Jewish deli menu, and stuff to soak up the alcohol if you're out late at night. I don't understand why people line up at the place across the street, but let them. I'll keep The Main to myself.

Every once in a while, you go to a restaurant that transports you. This is one of those places. Grab a booth and order two things. First a beer- because you're thirsty and Montreal has awesome beers on tap everywhere. Then you will, and you must, order the deceptively simple smoked meat sandwich. It's a thing of beauty my friends. Expertly carved and miraculously seasoned with a witches brew of clove and all things nice. The yellow mustard cuts the richness and the soft rye bread is like a warm jewish handshake. Quite simply- it's the greatest meat put between two slices I've ever had. I told the dude cutting the meat that it was the tastiest sandwich I've ever had, to which he replied by slipping me a plate of more delicious meat for 'the rest of your beer.'  You must go here.

What a horrible unmemorable name (the "Deli Steakhouse" part. I get the history of the "Main part, but still the sum of its parts is just forgettable). And do they even have steak? Just as bad was the dated, not very charming interior. I dig old restaurants but this seemed sad.Thankfully the food made up for it.We shared their specialty, a smoked meat sandwich. It was unexpectedly served with mustard (not mentioned on the menu) so my husband asked for new bread and I took the mustard-y pieces to make myself my own sandwich. (There was so much meat on the sandwich that we actually took it apart to make two new sandwiches.) We ordered medium leanness but wish wish we'd ordered it leaner. For the record, it *was* the expected amount of fat for medium leanness.The maztoh ball soup was very good. It wasn't Second Street Deli (NYC) or D.Z. Akin's (San Diego) quality but still was one of the better ones. It consisted simply of two balls and broth.The potato verenke was the clunker of the evening. We made the mistake of ordering it fried instead of boiled and it was just *too* fried. It was also a small portion - not that it mattered since we didn't really want it. The potato latkes were good and thick. For verenkes and latkes you could only pick a side of applesauce or sour cream to go with them and not both. Lame.Kathleen's International (okay, just the U.S. and Canada) Jewish Deli Rankings1) D.Z. Akin's, San Diego2) Centre Street Deli, Toronto3) Second Avenue Deli, New York City4) California Street Delicatessen & Café, San Francisco (closed)5) Ben's Kosher Deli, New York City6) Yonah Schimmel's Knishes Bakery, New York City7) MAIN DELI STEAKHOUSE, MONTREAL8) Carnegie Deli, New York City9) Miller's East Coast Deli, San Francisco10) Saul's, Berkeley11) Brother's Deli, Burlingame (closed)12) Ben's Kosher Deli, New York City13) Gunthers, San Jose(I'm not including Stage Deli in Las Vegas, Max's in San Francisco, or Nate n Al's in Beverly Hills.)

I'm a smoked meat addict, I love the stuff. While Main doesn't smoke their stuff in-house anymore, they still serve top notch quality stuff that still tastes the same. Every smoke meat joint have their own blend of spice. The Main tend to edge on the peppery side of things. I always order my sandwich on the fatter side of things, and it is always delicious sandwich at Mains. The service is always really nice, and they have beer. They are also open 24h and it is an amazing place for a late night meal or snack after clubbing.The old Eastern European classics are also amazing. I love the Verenekes and the Laktas, which a crispy carb bombs. Note: I don't understand why people go to smoked meat and order it lean. Try it fat or medium people.
Forget Schwartz's- I've eaten both! This is superb! Must have the smoked meat sandwich - perfect moisture and peppercorn!

It is hard to come across better service & food combo than we had at Main Deli. The smoked meat was like butter. I ended up stealing half of my husband's sandwich any time he looked away. The coleslaw was ah-mazing. We literally licked our plates clean and I normally take half of my portion home. Service was on point. Angelo is a family member and he is effortlessly the most friendly and attentive guy you can ever encounter. It is a 60 plus year old family business ran on secret recipes. Friendly priced and the value you get is much much beyond. Your tastebuds will thank you. Mine did.

The Main has been my favourite place for smoked meat, since I lived in Montreal.  Their smoked meat is super juicy (medium fat) and has so much flavor you won't be able to resist walking by this place without ordering a sandwich or the famous smoked meat poutine!I usually went to the Main after a long night of drinking and the food always tasted amazing day or night.  My suggestion is either a full platter (upgrade those fries to a poutine) if you're super hungry, along with a cherry coke.  Or if you want to keep it simple and to the point a smoke meat poutine always hits the spot.  There is something to be said about the gravy they use.  It is almost as if it is an Elixir from the gods sent down to earth for us to enjoy!This place is awesome and with no line up and much better tasting smoked meat and poutine, I would choose this place over the crowded Schwartz any day!

This place is soooooooooooo good!I had the combo plate with the smoked meat sandwich, and upgraded my fries to poutine. I didn't do the cherry soda. I started to get really full, so stopped eating the bread. The meat was smoked to perfection, and the "medium" had just the right proportion of fat. Oh, and the poutine's gravy...dang it. Way better than my grandma's meat gravy. And I didn't know that was possible!!The staff have more of a diner attitude. Short and to the point. But friendly, and gets the job done. No excessive service here, and it isn't needed. The food was great, and there isn't a wait. No need to go to tourist stop Schwartz's. There are other stops in town, and thanks to Yelp I found this one!
Great spot for a smoked meat sammy, a lot more chill and relaxed than Schwarz across the street and no line ups!  They have a good little patio as well that is great for summer people watching.

I am not going to compare them to the place across the street. The experience I had really speaks for itself and it was pretty bad. The customer service from the waitress - who I am assuming is the owner's wife based on age and the vibe coming from their chatter with each other- was terrible. When I walked in it was about 1030 and there was an awkward silence from her with a delayed "Yes?" In a tone that was as if they weren't open for business? They seemed to still be getting ready for the day but I mean if you don't want customers before 1100 then why open at 1000? Anyway service was pretty lackluster though the sandwich and other food was good. When I went to pay she wouldn't break a 50 for a 25 dollar check, inconvenient but not a huge deal. Only the way she communicated that reminded me of Consuela from Family Guy. Finally when she gave me my change I looked around for a tip jar and before a single second had passed she mumbled "was the service not good?"  Overall just weird, awkward, and almost passive aggressive service that left me feeling uncomfortable. Smoked meat sandwich was very good but there are better options in my experience.

Amazing service, food, everything! Got the smoke meat sandwich, A pint of Boreal Blonde with a pickle on the side. Sometimes that "place across the street" isn't always the best choice, really enjoyed myself here and you will too. - The establishment was clean- Service was 5 outta 5 - Price of food was adorable and well within reason. - portions were generous - Beer was cold and glasses were never empty. Can't say anything else but 10/10

Passing by Le Main on a hot summer Sunday, we marveled at the block-long lineup across the street at Schwartz's. Meanwhile, Le Main's streetside patio still had a couple of empty tables.We ordered smoked meat sandwiches (medium fat). They arrived in minutes. We scarfed them down with glee. This is definitely a quality sandwich with very moist, well spiced, above-average meat. (Note: must be washed down with Cotts Black Cherry pop).Even as I write this review, those poor people are still waiting in line for their sandwich at Schwartz's. Is Schwartz's meat really that much better? Those poor shmoes should've gone to Le Main!

Main is the Schwartz's *main* competitor (sorry). They're across the street from each other, and both serve Montreal smoked meat sandwiches, among other meats. The *main* difference (sorry again) is that Main is open late. Swung by at 3am and was able to get a sandwich and some fries. I wasn't a big fan of the fries (they were soggy and really sweet), but the sandwich was a great late night option. Not as good as Schwartz's, but it definitely hit the spot.

Stopped by late at night to see if the competitor of Schwartz also had smoked meat we could take back to the states and they were very generous to do soThey cut 1/2 lb portions for us and vacuumed-sealed them so they would make it through immigration the next day. It was slow when we came in, but the staff was super friendly. Can't wait to open them up and make a sandwich!
Best smoked meat in town - without the wait. Poutine and chicken soup of the day fresh and excellent as well.

4.5 stars. The long continued debate goes on and the final result is truly what you enjoy.   On my latest mission, I sacrificed my stomach to rest out the bigger names on the Montreal smoked meat arena.  They are all very similar but I found I enjoyed the flavor profile of The Main than the other 3.  Table service was a little lost but Mike's work more than made up for that little stumble.  The sandwich was well assembled. The meat not dry and cut into the oh so yummy melt in your mouth slices piled high.   Washed down with a dark cherry cola (apparently imported from Toronto), perfect duo.  I will be back to try the other offerings but definitely this place is a-ok in my books

Amazing Smoked Meat Sandwich!!Schwartz's is across the street and is the tourist attraction. The locals prefer Main Deli, so we did like the locals! Very happy with the nice people and wonderful service. Again, amazing food, homemade fries, homemade coleslaw and the attraction being the smoked meat!!

Shocked by the line up at the Schwartz's, decided to check out their rival, The Main Deli, and both momand I decided it was an excellent choice!I went with the super special, and mom had a smoked beef, what else would we have first time being in Montreal?  We also shared a matzoball soup.There is nothing to say except that everything was excellent, even the service was remarkable!  The sandwich was full of flavour, meaty and just simply delicious and definitely memorable.  It was also our first tine having matzoball soup which to my own surprise was very simple and flavourful.  Apparently this is the place where locals eat vs. The touristy Schwartz's, who probably does a better job marketing themselves.One of the best meals we've had in this beautiful city!

Went here on the advice of a bartender nearby who said this was a great place to go on St. Laurent. Fries: solid. Meet sandwich: that bartender told me to get the fatty or the medium. I got the fatty, and it was exquisite. Lots of meat and so juicy! Love the rye bread as well. Pickle: check! Baby K got the mozzarella burger.  It looked delicious, large, and packed with toppings.  She said it was top-notch. Moose got a burger - she just claimed "excellent." Burger for one of the boys, and meat sandwich for the other, and they both raved. Also, service was excellent by our young blond-haired waitress. It was quiet, cozy, and really a great place to go. So glad that we were recommended in that direction!

The server sat us and then proceeded to take other orders before ours. When we complained since we were in a hurry she snapped back at us that it was busy and that she couldn't be expected to keep track of what tables came in when.  The matzo ball soup was flavorless.  The smoked meat sandwich tasted like spam. The cheese on the poutine wasn't melted at all and the flavor of the gravy was nasty.  Since I didn't like the smoked meat sandwich I ordered a hamburger instead. That was fairly tasty.  The best thing about our experience was the Cotts cherry soda! Definitely get the Cotts!

I can only be fooled once... Last time when I was in Montreal, I followed all the advice of my friends to go Schwartz and of course I left unimpressed.... I didn't wait 1 hour in line, and no way I am going to do that nor going to eat at Schwartz again...Main Deli feels empty with no lines at 2 pm on a weekday afternoon... and here no tourists either. Of course I am here for the Smoked Meat! Super Special $11.45 (Sandwich, fries and drink), of course is a deal I wouldn't miss. One bite.. and I know it is the one. Juicy, Moist and Delicious! A great mix of fat and lean.........Roasted Beef Sandwich ($6.15) though was dry and bland. I don't think I would order that again!Main Deli also closes late! I can have a smoked meat sandwich as midnight snack?! SWEET!Next time when I am in town, I am going to wait for my friends here drinking a beer eating a smoked meat poutine while they wait for their turn to get into Schwartz's... Tourists!

Avoid the lines across the street at Scwartz's.  Had both; equally GOOD.  I guess for a tourist the idea of sitting in a jamppacked, really loud small restaurant that's fun (u can avoid the line by getting pick up/take out; trust me, sitting inside ain't that great!).  The Main moves quickly, also been around a long time.  I hesitate to tell all of this, mostly because selfishly I like that it's quiet.  Maybe just stand in the Schwartz line after all, less headache for me!  Or unselfishly; save yourself time and hassle; try THE MAIN.

A resoundingly average deli made far worse by the extremely rude older waitress on staff (wrinkled face, in her 60s.) She gave us an unmistakably nasty look when we ordered just a side order and two soft drinks (at 4 o'clock in the afternoon), grabbed away the side order while we were still eating it, and brought checks to all the other tables (only a few were occupied at this off hour), but not ours until we demanded it. Hard to believe the owner is paying her to lose customers for him -- I feel sorry for him or her.
See Jordan the Lion's vlog and review on YouTube. Jordanthelion#890

4 Stars - Montreal Smoked Meat rules. Now living in Toronto... I miss you immensely.Stopped by on a Tuesday evening at 3am after a night at the pubs. The place was about 20% full . Service was extremely quick and friendly. My first trip to the Main was probably 30 years ago with my parents as a young boy. There was always a debate in my family - The Main or Schwartz. The main usually won because it was less busy. This is obviously still true today and why I picked the Main on this evening. I do think Schwartz smoked meat is slightly better than the Main (better spice mix on the outside of the brisket).... But not by a whole lot and certainly not enough to wait in line for. First up - Matzo Ball Soup and it was delicious. Two huge Matzo balls served in rich chicken broth. A great meal starter on a cold evening. Next - The Smoked Meat Special including sandwich, soda, fries, pickle and coleslaw for $12. The Smoke Meat was served medium, just right for me. As good as I remembered throughout the years. All the meal add-ons were equally good, loved the fries and dill pickle.I do find The Main is starting to show it's age a little but some might refer to this as "old school charm". Nevertheless; I think the place could use a fresh coat of paint and updating.In the end, The Main is always worth a visit if your craving a Smoked Meat sandwich any time of the day / evening.   BK

Old school, I prefer this one to his front neighbors. The smoke meat is amazing, many options to choose from and always a warm welcome. This is one of my primary late night snack spot. Smoke meat poutine is amazing. The serve all the old world deli classics, and you can tell they've done it for a while. Solid and consistent. Keep up the good work.

What's not to like.....one the of the best old style delis left in MTL on the Main. Plus you don't have to wait in line at Schwartz's for the same quality food. Grilled karnatzle on fresh rye bread, stuffed chicken, kishke, matzah ball soup, smoked meat, cole slaw, pickles, beef short ribs, burgers, verenikas, latkes,.........is your mouth watering yet?? The food is outstanding, very reasonably priced, the service is excellent, what the hell do you need??!! Get off your tuchas and go have a bite at Main. You know, what?......screw it I'm going now, I'd rather have another stuffed chicken sandwich then continue writing this post :)
Across the street from Schwartz but I think Just As Good. Their smoked meat pastrami on rye with mustard and a side of cole slaw is fantastic.

My friends and I shared the Smoked Meat combo and Deluxe- with Roast Beef combo and they were both super mouth watering and a burst of flavor in your mouth. I would eat these guys over and over again if it wasn't at the end of our Canada trip.

Blatantly racist treatment by Dimitri to a group of South Asian CANADIANS a couple weeks ago (not that their birth place should matter here). After treating them poorly and literally saying things like "The food is not Kosher - this is CANADA!" and giving them attitude all night, a few of the group decided not to tip him (COMPLETELY UNDERSTANDABLE!!). Dimitri was behaving like a child stomping around the restaurant and drawing attention. God forbid you don't tip someone treating you like shit?! This restaurant should invest in racial bias training and fire this guy immediately. It's only a matter of time before this is a national news story. I will never eat there in the future.

TL;DR: Worst meal we had in Montreal. For the love of Montreal, avoid this place. The smoked meat is dry, the poutine nasty, the vibe fake. Listen to the bad reviews here.This was our last meal in Montreal, and the worst. We came here to try and combine our need for more poutine and smoked meat before the drive back to Toronto. We opted for the (you guessed it) smoked meat poutine, but also a pickle and the coleslaw. Poutine: Every element of this dish was poor quality. Don't listen to the people trying poutine for the first time, what do they know? The smoked meat was dry and relied on the gravy. The fries were under cooked and dense-potato (a good sign they were not blanched), the gravy was supppper salty and a bit corn-starchy thick, the cheese curds were still tasty, but the worst quality of all cheese curds we ate in Montreal as they had no squeak.The pickle was a normal jarred pickle, I doubt they are homemade and they didn't even select a high quality brand. The coleslaw was lettuce heavy and had clearly sat in the dressing for a while as it was pickled and lacked much crunch. Service was friendly enough but the whole vibe was forced like they were trying to live up to the "you gotta eat here" T.V show. Maybe it was the American family eating near us, but it was the first time all trip I didn't feel like I was in Montreal. When another table asked what their specialty was, the server said the steak, so maybe they even know Schwartz is better at smoked meat.

I don't understand why this place isn't more full.I came here yesterday given I have seen this place my whole life, always walked by it, I thought why not? Give it a try.And I'm very glad I did. If I want smoked meat, why would I bother going to that other place when I can come here, not sit in elbow-to-elbow cramped quarters, be able to pay with a card, have super-friendly service and even have a glass of wine thrown in on the house?The slaw and pickle I had were perfect. The steak and fries were just right and the German Chocolate Cake was moist and not super sickly sweet.  I enjoyed eating here and won't hesitate to come back.

My intention was actually to go to Schwartz's for a Montreal Smoked Meat sandwich, but when I got there, the place was closed. So, I decided to visit it's No. 1 rival across the street, Main Deli. The decor was very dated, and I'm not sure if that was intentional, but common for many of the businesses in Montreal. Parking consists of metered street parking, and bicycle parking.It was later in the evening when I arrived, around 20:30 and the place was not busy considering it was Family Day. I ordered the staples: A Classic Poutine, and a Smoked Meat Sandwich, with a cherry cola to wash it all down. I also tried their French Onion Soup just for the sake of it.French Onion Soup. All the traditional ingredients and flavours were there. Beef based broth, onions and bread all underneath a blanket of cheese. The soup is known to be salty with the onions giving it a sweetness, but it was a bit too salty for my tastes. I also prefer flavoured croutons over bread as it takes longer to break down and it's not simply a soggy mess of starch when you eat it, but I won't punish them for sticking to the classic recipe. The Cheese was done nicely, melted and seared on top. Still, I've had and expected better. 2 stars.Classic Poutine. Fries, Cheese Curds, and Brown Sauce. A dish as common as mashed potatoes in Montreal. With limitless variations of the dish, I always tend to gravitate to the classic just to ensure I get a good taste of the Brown Sauce (gravy) as this is key to the entire dish in my opinion. The cut of the fries was very consistent, an indicator that they were not hand cut, and the potatoes were prepared with the skin on. They were slightly on the greasy side (an indicator that the oil was not hot enough, need changing, or that it was fried in lard) and reminded me of classic fish and chips type fries. The gravy was nothing special, your typical salty beef based brown sauce. 2 stars.Smoked Meat Sandwich. This dish came with fries, coleslaw, and a pickle. I ordered a medium (fat ratio) cut and it came as requested with a fair amount of fat to ensure flavouring. Unfortunately, it still did not stand out. The closest comparison to Montreal Smoked meat would be New York Pastrami, but even then they're worlds apart in terms of texture and flavour. Montreal Smoked meat is uses Beef Brisket, a stringier meat; whereas Pastrami uses the Beef Navel (the meat adjacent to the Brisket), a more tender fattier cut of meat (closer to the belly and similar to where you would get bacon from on a pig). But if you steam the brisket properly, the meat will break apart very easily. It'll still be stringy, but it will also be super tender, and this is where the texture comes in. American Pastrami is more marbled with fat and has a more dense texture.Enough of the technical jargon, back to the review.. Montreal Smoked meat is all about the rub during the smoking, salting, and curing process. The smokiness should be intense, and the flavours from the rub should complement. In my opinion, Main Deli came up short here. The meat was salty, but lacked any depth in flavour from the spices, and came up short in smokiness. 2 stars.Despite my review, Main Deli is a huge local favourite, but tastes are highly subjective, and I'm sure my opinion is that of the minority. I suggest that you try for yourself and come to your own conclusions. In the meantime, my quest to try Schwartz's will simply have to wait until my next trip back...

Best Deli in Montreal! A trip down Jewish memory lane......kishka...verenikas and latkes...they home cook the best I've ever had. Outstanding smoked meat...better than Schwartz's. Warm and efficient service.I highly recommend this place!!

Equal to "The Best"Rather not line up for an hour at Schwartz's? Step into Main Deli for the same, or perhaps superior, smoked meat perfection. Fries and pickle equally perfect. Didn't believe it was possible but now I know. - from a July 2016 visit.

Every time I craved smoked meat sandwich, I used to hit Schwartz. I was so blinded by the Hype that I never noticed this gem of a place. A couple of my local Montreal friends asked me to try Main Deli steak house and finally today I did. Had one bite of the smoked meat sandwich and it was magic. Thick slices of medium fatty Montreal smoked meat, piled on mustard laden rye bread.  Just awesome. Advantages this place has over Schwartz :Way better smoked meat sandwichesQuiet and CleanerIts not Cash only. they take cardsNo long lineupsFood : GreatService :FriendlyAmbiance : casualWorth the price : Hell Yes

Solid smoked meat sandwich in Montreal. The sandwich is quite juicy, and I'd definitely recommend it with a side of pickles and hot peppers. I wouldn't say it blows other smoked meat sandwiches out of the water, but this is certainly a good one.

I went here for dinner after having Schwartz for lunch. I liked that they take credit cards, but this does NOT even come close to competing. Stand in line and wait for the real thing. Before getting to the food, the waiter and the cook were having some sort of fight and cursing at each other under their breath. The waitress was very cold, I'm assuming because of this, but it made me feel pretty uncomfortable. Not a pleasant environment to eat in at all. I ordered coleslaw, French onion soup, and a smoked meat sandwich. The coleslaw was not to my liking and I left it mostly untouched, but I'll chalk that up to personal preference. The French onion soup was ok. I wouldn't order it again. Then the smoked meat sandwich came out. The meat was not as juicy or flavorful as Schwartz. It's heavier on the pepper flavor if you're into that. Schwartz also makes their own mustard which to me is a big part of what makes the sandwich so good. The sandwich here wasn't terrible, but certainly mediocre in the flavor department.Unfortunately to make matters worse, there was a piece of a styrofoam container in my sandwich. When I told the waitress about it she kind of blew it off. The cook offered me a couple extra pieces of meat to make up for it which was considerate, but ultimately I was disappointed overall due to:-feeling uncomfortable due to the staff fighting -waitress attitude -the food not being very good-styrofoam in my sandwich If this was a direct comparison to Schwartz I would give this place 1 star and recommend you don't even bother, but as an objective review of only the sandwich I'll give it a 2 as it is mediocre substitute (assuming the staff isn't always cursing at each other and there isn't always inedible additions to the sandwiches).

Service is surprisingly good here. I brought a friend over to have some Montreal smoked meat. Admittedly, we were going to head to schuartz across the street. While that was packed with a lineup, main deli was empty. I always knew about main deli, but I was surprised how under-appreciated this place is. We ordered the smoked meat poutine, tackle two birds with one stone, and it was good! A must try for an

When you come to Montreal, you have to try their Smoked Meat sandwich. I've previously been to The Main's competition on a number of occasions. I decided to try The Main (regarded as the #2 in Montreal). First of all, the big difference I noticed, was the wait time for a table. There was no wait. As soon as we entered, the employee who greeted us said we can sit anywhere. We went around 11:30 on a Sunday. There was only one other customer in the restaurant when we entered so we had plenty of options of where to sit. The Smoked Meat sandwich, I thought was a 3 out of 5. If I did not previously had The Main's competition before, I would give the sandwich a 4.5 out of 5. Now I understand the reason for the long lines across the street. The Main's customer service was amazing. The server we had was very friendly and always checked in on us. Another plus of the restaurant was the free Wifi. Being an American tourist, I shut my mobile data off when traveling in Canada, so it was nice to catch up on some emails and enjoy social medial while I waited for the food to be prepared. Unfortunately, I do not think I will return to the Main for smoked meat sandwiches. Albeit their sandwich was good, but I believe the one across the street is better.

This is what you come to Montreal for.Several Vancouver places have tried to claim best smoked meat outside of Montreal or even claiming they fly it fresh from Montreal, but nothing comes close to the real deal.My buddy Nachiket P referred me to this place. Better than Schwartz and no line. Sure enough as I arrive I see the line at Schwartz and no line here.Chef smiles and greets me in English. It was nearly empty and he says 'Any table boss. VIP service!'. Love it.Classic diner seating. I order the lunch special with comes with coleslaw, fries, and a big pickle. The slaw had great vinegar kick. Usually hard to find a good slaw.And the main event made me smile after the 1st bite. Juicy all the way through. Perfect amount of fat. Mustard and bread didn't distract.Merci meat man. Merci.
It is just cross street of Deli Schwartz. We love their smoke meat sandwich, really delicious!

1. Food: smoked meat was delicious - each piece was fresh, juicy, and flavorful. Marbled, but not fatty. Smoked turkey, on the other hand, was quite dry and tough. Not the best. Matzoh ball soup was quite tasty too. The regular poutine was good too - thick gravy, soft cheese curds. 2. Atmosphere: sat in the sidewalk patio area. Very relaxed. Street traffic was steady but not overbearing. Marked contrast to Schwartz's Deli across the street (packed and hectic). 3. Service: decent.

I will never go back to Schwartz's again. I had a pretty lack luster experience last time I was there, but definitely still needed my smoked meat fix while in Montreal - thankfully some Montreal locals recommended Main Deli. No line up, no abrupt service, not nearly as crowded. Schwartz's is definitely the most touristy of the smoked meat joints in Montreal, but Main Deli seemed to draw a smaller crowd of regulars, the servers seemed to know many clients by name. The menu consists of different sandwiches, and classic Jewish dishes like Matzo ball soup, chopped liver, latkes etc. My boyfriend ordered the smoked turkey and I ordered the smoked meat with a side of poutine and the iconic black cherry cot soda. The slices of meat are thicker than they give you at Schwartz's and the meat is tender and moist, mmm. The seasoning is peppery and delicious. As with any Montreal smoked meat sandwich, the sandwich was like 90% meat with two pieces of rye slapped on either side, super filling. The smoked meat plate came with a slice of pickle, I'm not a pickle fan so I can't comment on how it was. My poutine was also very good. My boyfriend loved the smoked turkey. If I lived in Montreal I'd definitely be a regular here... I'd love to try some of the different Jewish dishes on the menu next time I'm in town!

I used to go to Schwartz's Deli, but finally had enough with their cash only policy - this is 2018 and Had enough with their ATM fee. After I found out that Celine Dion owned it I had enough. I knew the reason it's cash only, which is unfair to the people of Canada... we all pay taxes bc there's a record for most people... Anyhow, Main is INCREDIBLE- INCREDIBLE SERVICE, SUPERIOR MEAT AND IT'S NOT A TOURIST TRAP!!! Plus they serve beer and wine... Does Schwartz's?! No!

Located on the other side of the street from the famous smoke meat joint, Schwartz. I was quite surprised that the smoked meat is just as good. I liked their coleslaw, which was particularly a good complement to the greasy fries and smoke meat. What I find sad however, is the fact that the smoke meat sandwich is not edible without the help from the pickle. coleslaw, and heavy mustard.Despite the terrasse, the servers didn't seem particularly happy/proud about their job (prolly wishing they had as many customers as Schwartz since they serve same quality food). And my order of smoke meat platter took over 10min to get out of the kitchen (and I was the only ordering customer). But yeh, people should still consider the Main Deli next time they find themselves waiting in line under the hot summer sun for Schwartz. In terms of 'Montreal Smoke Meat', the two shops serve comparable food.

Smoked Meat Sandwich was moist but a little salty. Had a huge bang of thirst an hour after consuming the sandwich. Went on a Sunday noon, while their rival across the street had a line out on the sidewalk, this little deli were surprisingly (in a good way) not busy at all. They have a nice patio and lots of seats inside the restaurant. Service was a little slow. Waited forever to pay for my sandwich, due to miscommunication between the staff, they seem to forget that I haven't paid. It's not a bad place for a smoked meat sandwich if you want to skip the line and find a seat.

I really enjoyed my meal here! After finding out that Schwartz's is cash only (thanks, Yelpers!) I decided to head across the street to Main Deli. There was no line, the service was quick, and the sandwich was delicious! I just ordered the plan smoked meat sandwich, since I wasn't really hungry enough for the special, which comes with fries, coleslaw, a pickle, and a drink (and is probably a great deal). I really enjoyed the pepperyness of the meat, and the mustard was also a great addition. Overall, great option if you're looking for a smoked meat sandwich and want something quicker than Schwartz's!

My girlfriend and I were planning on finally hitting up Schwartz as we both had never tried it before. As we were walking down trying to find it a man overheard us talking and recommended we go the "The Main" just across the street from Schwartz as "it's much better, cheaper and less crowded". We thanked him. A little skeptical, we walked to The Main to check out the menu. As we were looking at it an older couple walked out and essentially told us that they had been coming to The Main for decades and that Schwartz pales in comparison and is only a tourist trap. By this point we had made up our mind and excitingly walked into the cute yet lively dinner that would soon give us one of the best meals Montreal has to offer.We shared a poutine and both had the smoked meat sandwich. Both were out of this world, the poutine was arguably one the best poutine's I've ever had and the smoked meat sandwich melted in your mouth. We both left the restaurant feeling high due to the foodgasmic experience we had both just embarked on.Screw Schwartz, walk across the street to The Main and you'll leave happy and satisfied. It doesn't get better than this!

I once wrote a glowing review of The Main, which was my favourite spot in Montreal. But man, have times changed. Unfortunately, the original owner of The Main passed away a few years ago, and it was purchased by a new group. They've made a lot of changes since then, and not necessarily for the best.What was once a chill environment with a classic Jewish deli vibe, is now a brightly-coloured sports bar-esque joint with large TVs and bright lights. It's tacky and bizarre.As for the food, the good news is that they kept a lot of the old staff, so the food is somewhat consistent. Although, apparently the smoked meat is no longer made in house, and some feel it doesn't taste a good as the old brisket. BUT, the big issue is that the food prices skyrocketed while portion sizes have shrunk. I understand that food costs have gone up over the past few years, but everything on the menu is 30-50% more than it was 5-6 years ago, and some items have even doubled in price! That is a massive leap. Couple this with the fact that the smoked meat sandwich and poutine sizes seem to have shrunk quite a bit, makes this place not the value it once was. In fact, it's pretty damn expensive now for what you get. My friends and I were diehards of The Main and would meet there all the time. Now? I've been once or twice in the past year. I can still enjoy a meal there, but it's just not the same. The old adage persists: if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

I'm not sure what the hype is about here, but I will most definitely not be coming back.This is the place you go to on a very very late night after hanging out with friends, where you don't care about taste or quality and just want to fill your stomach.We were a large group and ordered various items on the menu ranging from the potato latkas to burger/fries to smoked meat sandwiches to a keylime pie... and the list goes on.How is it possible that every single dish was unsatisfying? Super greasy and badly made.Service was slow which didn't help either.Not really as great as people say it is!

Ordered takeout smoke meat poutine. It taste amazing and the take out box is nice too! Service is way better than the one opposite to the street. (I have only ordered take out from both of the place before)

I have fond memories of eating at the main as child/teen with my parents, all tucked in a booth. I'd usually have the smoked meat or a hamburger, my dad and my sister would both have smoked meat and my mom would eat the liver. Fast forward 15 or 20 years, and history is repeating itself. You will occasionally find my boyfriend and I cozied up in a booth with a friend or two, chowing down. Key change: sometimes *I* get the liver. And its just like I remember it.  The wait staff hasn't changed, they are friendly with a little bit of attitude.  The food is plentiful and delicious.The next time you have a craving for a smoked meat sandwich and don't feel like braving the line across the street, do yourself a favor and stop in at the Main.

A really nice deli in the plateau and right across the road from Schwartz's. There's actually a lot more to choose from their menu besides smoked meat. The ribs are quite good and there's also a decent selection of desserts. A great alternative to skip the line at Schwartz's.

Simply one if the best Delis in Montreal. A true gem, I'd rather sit comfortably and have the great friendly service than stand outside for an hour across the street.Their smoked meat is comforting, savoury as were the fries, coleslaw served with a delicious pickle! Don't forget the Black Cherry Soda ;) They have yesterday's still fresh loaf of bread for sale for just a $ 1.00! That tells you as well how fresh their meals are regularly!A must on a regular basis.

My GF & I walked in and the place was empty .  I'm gluten free and asked to buy it by the pound or sandwich with out the bread.  I mentioned it was to dine in.I sat down to eat and they said I couldn't sit and eat it.  They asked me to leave.  We went outside and waited for our Uber.After a few minutes I used an outside table to put the food on it to eat.  The lady came outside and told me to stop using the tableThe smoked meat was goodThe staff wasn't friendly
Heard about this place on 'You Gotta Eat Here' and was curious.  Tried the special and the main burger. Both were really good.  Smoky and flavourfu. Great portion sizes too!

I mean...what can I say? They have smoked meat. They have poutine. They have a lot more space than the across-the-street Schwartz's. All of those are a win for me. Oh, also, their borscht is pretty dang good, if you're into that sort of thing.It's super dodgy inside, the service is fairly unfriendly, the lighting is dark, but that's all part o' the deal. It's an experience I would recommend. Generally full of characters. And you will be rewarded with some pretty decent food.

Choose the Main, skip the tourists, stay warm!How can we not compare The Main with Swartz accross the street, where all the sheepish wait in line in freezing cold temperature just to be seated crammed between annoying smelly loud tourists on tables reminiscent of prison cafeterias? To eat their overhyped dry sandwich, then trying to clean your hands in their cruddy wc...The Main has an actual FULL MENU, comfortable PRIVATE seating, NO LINEUP, less tourists, the waiters are friendly, the roast beef is delicious, the smoke meat is delicious.I've been to Swartz many times before I decided to try The Main and I have never been back. The Main is a great cheap deli, not a factory. Try it once and you will also never go back to Swartz.
Visited this place after a night of clubbing and drinking, was not disappointed. Loved the food and the service.

Delicious smoked meat!!! You should also try the roast beef which is actually so freaking good!! I'd come here over schwartz - just as good, sans lineup. The boss lady or server was really rude for whatever reason to our table, but super friendly just to the people next to us. I dont know I hate playing the racist card but... We were a table of asians hahahaha so....

The food here is mediocre at best. The service is far worse. Our waitress had no interest in answering our questions about the menu and literally tossed our plates onto the table as she walked by without stopping. One of the items we ordered never made it to us (because they forgot to make it--not because of poor aim), but the waitress put up a fight when we asked her to remove that item from our bill.Easily our worst experience eating out in Montreal.

We came to Main Deli because the line at Schwartz's deli across the street was an hour long.  The food at Main Deli is very good and the wait staff is adequately attentive.  The one issue I had with the restaurant is that I witnessed the wait staff drop a clean fork to the ground and then put it back into the packaging of a new silverware package for a future patron to use while consuming food.  The staff who dropped the fork was very elderly and I infer his standards of sanitation are just different.  I would have preferred if he had placed the fork he dropped with the dirty silverware instead of the clean silverware.

So the food was fine, whatever. Went here only because the line at Schwartz across the street was too long and because it was close to where we were staying. Had smoked meats the first time and went back for poutine. Decent.I'm writing this review to comment on the service which was terrible. Both times we had the same older lady serving us and she was terribly rude. I'm usually not very sensitive to indifferent service but this lady was plain rude and dismissive. Ruined our entire experience the second time as she made her displeasure over serving us known in her tone and expression. Eventually we handed her the wrong amount of cash (more) by mistake and she pocketed the cash in front of us instead of handing it back when we ll realized an error had been made. She dismissed us by saying "I work very hard for my money". I'm sure she does but she did not work hard for those 20 CAD, she stole them.

The smoked meat was solid, i had the plain poutine which was good too. Overall the food was good and fairly cheap. Definitely worth a visit. Especially with the declining smoke meat across the street.

From my experience, it's somewhat sacrilegious to declare that you just don't like smoked meat around here. Every single person I've told had that look on their face like I just killed their cat.Luckily, The Main has things other than smoked meat sandwiches, unlike their neighbor Schwartz's. I heartily recommend the pierogies - or as they're called on the menu, vareniki - with sour cream. Ask for them fried! (Note to the Russians/Ukrainians/Belarussians reading this: they aren't actually vareniki, they are more like the Americanized pierogies.)The atmosphere inside is a little greasy spoon-ish, but their outdoor terrace is absolute dynamite when you're in need of a greasy snack after drinking all night.

The owner contacted me from my last revue and invited me to the shop to try it again. I must say I was impressed with the apology and the gesture.He has changed the focus of the business away from smoked meat and toward grass fed organic burgers. His goal is to refocus the business and expand/franchise it. He was welcoming and kind. The meat was much better, though is still not house made. Cheers to the kindness of the owner, and best of luck with the new venture. The smoked meat being still store bought is a bit of a downer. The quality is good.

Solid Montreal Smoked Meat & Great Deli Fare.When it comes to Montreal smoked meat, people tend to think Schwartz's, but just across the street, The Main Deli serves a great alternative to Schwartz's long lines and slipping quality control. And it's no big secret either. The Main Deli is almost as rich in history as Schwartz', and the walls are adorned with pictures and cartoons of celebrities and politicians who've frequented the joint over the years.And should you be craving something other than brisket, their menu offers a slew of traditional deli options. A few other must-try dishes include:- potato latkes- chopped liver- and smoked turkeyOverall, if you haven't given The Main a shot, or if you don't feel like waiting in line out in the cold, consider crossing the road to one of the most underrated but authentic smoked meat joints in town.

The Main, although overshadowed by Schwartz's, is a Montreal institution that has been around for ages. It's definitely a spot that can be counted on to satisfy your late night munchies! It looks like your typical diner. Service is fast and efficient. They have great specials, but keep in mind that pricing varies by time of day. The menu here is vast! Not good for indecisive people! I ended up getting a side of perogies. They were tasty but I wasn't expecting them to be deep fried, so they were a bit greasy for my liking. They came with delicious fried onions and sour cream. I also shared the super-special with my DC. It comes with a smoked meat sandwich, pickles, coleslaw, fries, and a soft drink (or coffee or tea). The coleslaw is quite refreshing and is oil and vinegar-based instead of doused in mayo. Like. The meat was also delicious and the portion was generous. We upgraded the fries to poutine which was the best idea ever. Loads of melted cheese curds and gravy that reminded me of Swiss Chalet (in a good way). Note that there is a $3 sharing charge, however since I ordered my own side dish, they didn't mind us sharing. Cheap, yummy, fast, and open late... I would definitely come back. The Main sure beats some of the lame options along St. Catherine if you are looking to sit down for a bite and most kitchens are closed. I would even come here in the daytime, which means it's pretty good!
Fabulous smoked meat sandwich, fabulous poutine. An excellent alternative to the much busier competitor across the street.

FINALLY, got to eat smoked meat in Montreal.Some back story: We moved to Montreal last summer, and were told about the city staples, like Schwartz. But every time I walked past those places (like Banquise, too), there was always DOZENS of ppl queueing in the street, even in the snow! Anyway, I kept getting told about The Main, that it was better/Leonard Cohen used to go there etc, but kind of just stuck to the idea of Schwartz's. Anyway, over a year passed because I never found myself wanting to queue for a basic sandwich in 2014. I know what smoked meat is, eaten it tons, I just wanted the novelty..Anyway, so, last night, walking past Schwartz, I see the same queue of tourists and just think, "Ugh, not tonight." Plus it looks bright and kinda clinical and fast moving inside and we were in a lazy mood. But then, walking past it, I noticed The Main opposite the street, with.... pretty much the exact same stuff. However, they also had a beautifully lift street terrace, and attentive friendly waiters, and tons of simple, stripped down smoked meat/mustard. Plus, Montrealers have been telling me it's better, and that Schwartz's was more touristy. So, we just said, let's do it.We were given an awesome table, with a great server, where we were able to sit and watch the queue at Schwartz's while sipping on red wine (something they have that Schwartz's doesnt). I ordered the special: SM Sandwich, Fries, Pickle, Coleslaw. It arrived shortly after, and it was totally lovely.We had a great time, and it was so easy, and so lovely, and some of the best smoked meat I have ever eaten, very lean and nice. I will never bother going to Schwartz's now. I have found my place if I want that kind of thing. Friendly, open, spacious, more options, outdoor terrace, alcohol, same exact food, plus more, history of famous clientele, etc. Why queue? Like Banquise, I will boycott Schwartz's now, more out of principle. Although I actually tried Banquise, to much disappointment. I find it quite rude to mislead tourists and make them queue for something that is famous for being unglamorous; like making tourists queue for pizza and hot dogs in the states. Smoked Meat/Poutine are not fine dining queue type of foods, they're tourist traps. If there's a queue in the snow outside your shop, expand, or work faster, it's not the 1920s.The Main all the way.. What Le Main has that Schwartz's doesn't is customer appreciation and convenience.
Good smoked meat but bad service. Seems like in Montreal you have to deal with rude service to eat smoked meat.
Waiter Dimitri is very racist. Me and 12 of my friends felt very unwelcomed. 0/5 stars for me

Terrible service. We were seated after a brief wait, and the server never came back. No menus, no water, nothing. She looked at us, acknowledged our wave, and proceeded to completely ignore us. We waited 20 minutes, and left. Food looked good, but good luck getting it. Horrible.

New ownership ! Charge for a single sandwich 22$ plus 3$ sharing fees, Fries had a taste of dirt. It used to be a good place unfortunately its over for now and you will need some great arguments to get me back in !

With Schwartz's across the street, this place probably gets overlooked by the tourists which is a real shame.After having gone to the takeout counter at Schwartz's for a sandwich (as the line was soo long and we didn't want to wait), we decided to check out Main Deli Steak House to see how their sandwich would compare.FOODWell, simply put, the smoked meat sandwich was better than Schwartz's.  You also have the choice of how lean you want your meat.  While we chose 'medium', I have to say I would choose a little more fat next time for a little more flavor.  A friend also had the coleslaw which he raved about saying it was the best he has ever tasted.  SERVICEOur waitress was nice and the service was good and attentive.  No complaints here.So, what else can I say?  If you are local, you probably already know about it so hopefully the tourists will read this and check it out.  I'll definitely check it out again if I'm ever in the neighborhood.
Great deli food. One of the best smoked meats I've ever had. Try the chopped liver if you are a fan. Really well done.  Matzo Ball soup is simple and delicious.
